Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.

Sincerely,
Dayna Lamkey, MA, LLPC
Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has bruising to his face. His nose and lip were bleeding.
Youth A says he was assaulted by Staff 1.
Investigation Complainant was contacted via phone on 3/18/25. Complainant
reported Youth A was observed that morning during court to have
been cleaning his nose and lip stating that they were bleeding.
Complainant reported Youth A had an ice pack. Complainant
reported Youth A stated Staff 1 caused the injuries.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face along with MDHHS
Specialist on 3/19/25. Youth A reported Staff 1 was telling him to
get off the table and he did not follow directions. Youth A said they
argued back and forth and Youth A put his arms out in front of him
for personal space at which point Staff 1 smacked them down.
Youth A reported he leaned in as though he was going to hit Staff
1, even though he never meant to hit him. Staff 1 then hit Youth A
in the nose causing it to bleed. Youth A reported he then smacked
Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 grabbed him in the corner of the
room by his face and neck, causing the scratch under his chin and
the scratch above his right eye. Youth A said he tried to push Staff
1 off him, but Staff 1 was still trying to grab him. Youth A said this
all ended when other staff came to help. Youth A reported the
incident occurred on pod D2 and there were several other youth
around. Youth A could not recall which youth were around. Youth
A reported Staff 2 was there and witnessed the incident. He also
stated Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were present and came to
assist to break up the fight. Youth A said he did receive medical
attention for his injuries. Youth A reported he has not had an issue
with Staff 1 or any other staff since this incident and has not seen
Staff 1 since the incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. Staff 1 reported he got along fine
with Youth A until that morning, noting Youth A was agitated and
appeared stressed out by the way he was moving around and not
2

listening to instructions to get off the table. Staff 1 said Youth A
was sitting on the table and he asked him to get down but he
would not. Staff 1 reported he was trying to get Youth A to calm
down by approaching him and talking to him at which time Youth
A punched him. Youth A told Staff 1 he punched him because
Staff 1 hit him, but Staff 1 denied hitting Youth A. He reported he
leaned towards Youth A and that is when Youth A thought Staff 1
hit him because Youth A was bleeding. Youth A then punched
Staff 1 in the face. Staff 1 reported he turned away from Youth A
as he continued to throw punches. Staff 1 said when Youth A
punched him, his partner, Staff 2 came up to assist. Staff 1
reported that he saw Youth A was bleeding from his nose, but did
not observe any other injuries at the time.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along
with MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. Supervisor 1 reported she was
informed of the incident after it occurred, having been called to the
scene when it ended. Supervisor 1 reported the incident occurred
right before Youth A had court. Supervisor 1 reported she did not
observe Youth A and Staff 1 in a physical altercation. Supervisor 1
said she observed Youth A with a scratch on his face that was
bleeding. Supervisor 1 reported she did not hear Youth A say
anything about Staff 1 or where the injuries came from at the time.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A received medical attention for his
injuries. She stated there were no concerns with Staff 1,
elaborating that he is typically the staff who is good at calming the
kids down and she has never had concerns with him being
aggressive towards the youth in the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. Staff 2 reported she remembers
seeing Youth A hit Staff 1 in the face, stating that it was either a
slap or a punch. Staff 2 reported when she got over to the area
Youth A had moved from the table to the corner where Staff 1 was
leaning towards Youth A. Staff 2 said it did not seem aggressive,
rather it seemed as though they were playing around and then
suddenly Youth A hit Staff 1. Staff 2 denied observing Staff 1
strike Youth A at any time. Staff 2 denied observing Staff 1 be
aggressive with any youth, including Youth A during this incident
or any others. Staff 2 denied observing Staff 1 push, shove, or
strike Youth A. Staff 2 said she observed Staff 1 attempting to talk
to Youth A to calm him down and nothing else. Staff 2 denied
observing Staff 1 grab or restrain Youth A during the incident.
Staff 2 said, following the incident she did not see Youth A as he
had court. Staff 2 reported she did not know when he received
medical attention.
3

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. Youth B reported he was on the pod
during the incident between Staff 1 and Youth A. Youth B reported
he was in his room at the start of the incident therefore he did not
know how it started. Youth B reported he saw Youth A with a
scratch on his face, Youth B pointed to his forehead to show that
the scratch was observed to be located above Youth A’s right eye.
Youth B reported he believed he remembered that the scratch
was bleeding. Youth B said Youth A seemed angry and was
saying stuff, but did not remember what Youth A was saying.
Youth B reported he did not have any concerns with Staff 1 and
denied witnessing Staff 1 ever being aggressive toward any youth
at the facility including Youth A. Youth B reported he did not see
Youth A or Staff 1 hit each other and he only came out of his room
at the end of the incident.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. Youth C reported he knows Staff 1
and Youth B. Youth C reported he has never had any concerns
with Staff 1 or observed him to be aggressive with any of the
youth including Youth A. Youth C denied observing the incident
between Staff 1 and Youth A. Youth C reported he observed
Youth A with a scratch on his face but he did not see how he
received it.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. Youth D reported he did not see the
incident between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth D reported he did not
hear anything said after the incident. Youth D reported he has no
issues with Staff 1 and he is a really good staff. Youth D denied
witnessing Staff 1 be aggressive with any youth including Youth A.
Youth D reported he did see Youth A with a scratch on his face
but he did not see how he received it.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone call along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/8/25. Supervisor 2 reported he was not
present for the incident and does not know what occurred.
Supervisor 2 reported he has not had any concerns with Staff 1
being aggressive with youth. Supervisor 2 reported he was not
aware of what injuries or marks Youth A had following the
incident. Supervisor 2 reported he was not called to the floor to
respond to this incident.
Video Review:
Video footage from 3/18/2025 Pod D2 was viewed. Video footage
shows Staff 1 reach his right arm out as Youth A moves by him,
appearing to shove Youth A. Youth A is leaning against a table
while Staff 1 approaches and gets close to Youth A. Youth A
4

stands by a window and Staff 1 approaches and gets in close to
Youth A again. Staff 1 bumps Youth A with his body at which time
Youth A swings his right arm at him in response and hits him in
the face. Video shows Youth A standing, having removed his t-
shirt, making fists at his sides and breathing heavily when Staff 1
lunges forward at Youth A, grabbing Youth A with both arms into a
bear hug. Video shows Youth A alongside the wall towards the
corner of the pod with Staff 1’s back to the camera, moving
forward towards Youth A, while Youth A moves back into the
corner. Staff 1 has arms up near Youth A’s head and neck,
shoving youth into the corner.
Documentation reviewed:
• Nursing Progress Note regarding Youth A documents that
following an altercation with Staff 1 a skin tear on the right
side of the face above the eyebrow was treated. Redness
under chin was documented as having ice applied. Youth A
denied pain.
• Incident Report (IR) JDF032520431 dated 3/18/2025 authored
by Staff 2 notes that Staff 1 attempted to redirect Youth A
verbally to not sit on the table and Youth A threatened to slap
Staff 1. IR states once the author returned to the other end of
the pod shouting was heard and author observed Youth A
slapping Staff 1 and a code 10 was then called.
Analysis A violation is established regarding this allegation. Video footage
shows Staff 1 reach his arm at Youth A in an aggressive manner,
shoving him as he walks by him. Video footage shows Staff 1
aggressively moving at Youth A, cornering him with arms out and
making contact with Youth A’s face and head. Further, nurse’s
note documents the mark above Youth A’s right eye and under his
chin. Marks were also observed by consultant and MDHHS
Specialist during interview with Youth A during which time Youth A
reported they were from Staff 1 during the altercation.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & R 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Section prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
5

condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan
Violation Additional Finding of non-compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 put Youth A a bear hug which was an improper and
unnecessary restraint
Investigation Complainant was contacted via phone on 3/18/25. As indicated
above, Complainant did not provide any further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face along with MDHHS
Specialist on 3/19/25. As indicated above Youth A did not provide
any further information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. As indicated above, Staff 1 did not
provide any additional information.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along
with MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. As indicated above Supervisor
1 did not provide any additional information.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. As indicated above, Staff 2 denied
observing Staff 1 grab or restrain Youth A during the incident.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. As indicated above, Youth B did not
provide any additional information.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. As indicated above, Youth C did not
provide any additional information.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/3/25. As indicated above Youth D did not
provide any additional information.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone call along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/8/25. Supervisor 2 did not provide
additional information.
Video Review:
6

As noted above, video footage from 3/18/2025 Pod D2 was
viewed. Video shows Youth A standing, having removed his t-
shirt, making fists at his sides breathing heavily when Staff 1
lunges forward at Youth A, grabbing Youth A with both arms into a
bear hug.
Documentation Review:
The facility’s approved physical management policy does not
include a bear hug.
Analysis An additional finding of non-compliance is established. Despite
interviews from staff and youth witnesses denying witnessing Staff
1 hitting, striking, or shoving Youth A, video footage shows Staff 1
lunge forward at youth to wrap him in a bear hug which was
unnecessary, as Youth A was standing still at the time, and is not
an approved restraint technique.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2025SIC0000185, CAP pending
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
